Crime_Name: Deportation of a Bisexual Individual to Potential Harm
Legal_Issue: Can the removal of Mr. Abioye to Nigeria be stayed due to potential harm based on his sexual orientation?
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review application with a motion for stay of removal
Evidence_Assessment: Credible evidence of increased risks for homosexuals and bisexuals in Nigeria post-decision
Credibility_Factor: Officer incorrectly deemed the risk unchanged
Legal_Rule: Tripartite test from judicial precedent (serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience)
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to sexual orientation and worsening conditions for LGBTQ+ individuals in Nigeria
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Stay of removal ordered until underlying application is resolved
Key_Evidence_Considered: Increased risks for LGBTQ+ individuals in Nigeria after decision
Legal_Framework: Federal Court analysis of risks and legal standards
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of refugee claim and risk assessment error
Outcome: Stay granted pending resolution of underlying application
Claimant_Status: Mr. Abioye, bisexual individual facing deportation
Applicable_Process: Refugee claim and judicial review process
Governing_Rule: Tripartite test: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
